intro: Orophea chrysocarpa, commonly known as the golden fruit tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and large, palm-like leaves. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red fruits that are edible and contain a single seed. Orophea chrysocarpa is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
